item.title: North Korean Lazarus hackers infect hundreds via npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Six malicious packages have been identified on npm (Node package manager) linked to the notorious North Korean hacking group Lazarus. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes WebKit zero-day exploited in ‘extremely sophisticated’ attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Apple has released emergency security updates to patch a zero-day bug the company describes as exploited in "extremely sophisticated" attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5053606 update fixes broken SSH connections
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5053606 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, which fixes numerous bugs, including one preventing SSH connections. [...]

item.title: Microsoft March 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes 7 zero-days, 57 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's March 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 57 flaws, including six actively exploited zero-day vulnerabilities. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5053598 & KB5053602 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5053598 and KB5053602 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Microsoft replacing Remote Desktop app with Windows App in May
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced that it will drop support for the Remote Desktop app (available via the Microsoft Store) on May 27 and replace it with its new Windows App. [...]

item.title: MassJacker malware uses 778,000 wallets to steal cryptocurrency
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A newly discovered clipboard hijacking operation dubbed 'MassJacker' uses at least 778,531 cryptocurrency wallet addresses to steal digital assets from compromised computers. [...]

item.title: Critical PHP RCE vulnerability mass exploited in new attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Threat intelligence company GreyNoise warns that a critical PHP remote code execution vulnerability that impacts Windows systems is now under mass exploitation. [...]

item.title: The AI race: Dark AI is in the lead, but good AI is catching up
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Acronis
item.description: Cybercriminals are using AI for help in planning and conducting cyberattacks—but cybersecurity vendors are fighting back. Learn from Acronis Threat Research Unit about how AI-powered security solutions are closing the gap in the battle against AI-driven cyber threats. [...]

item.title: PowerSchool previously hacked in August, months before data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: PowerSchool has published a long-awaited CrowdStrike investigation into its massive December 2024 data breach, which determined that the company was previously hacked over 4 months earlier, in August, and then again in September. [...]

item.title: CISA tags critical Ivanti EPM flaws as actively exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA warned U.S. federal agencies to secure their networks against attacks exploiting three critical vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) appliances. [...]

item.title: X hit by 'massive cyberattack' amid Dark Storm's DDoS claims
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Dark Storm hacktivist group claims to be behind DDoS attacks causing multiple X worldwide outages on Monday, leading the company to enable DDoS protections from Cloudflare. [...]

item.title: US govt says Americans lost record $12.5 billion to fraud in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) said today that Americans lost a record $12.5 billion to fraud last year, a 25% increase over the previous year. [...]
